channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Israel and Hezbollah Trade Fire, and Polls Find Trump Ahead in Sun Belt States
item.description: Plus, the White Sox go for a record (low).

item.title: Pope Francis Cancels Meetings, Citing Flu With More Travel Looming
item.description: Francis, 87, is scheduled to visit Belgium and Luxembourg, meeting with sexual abuse survivors, within weeks of returning from a grueling Asia-Pacific...

item.title: Investors are betting on Wizz Air taking a hit amid price wars, debt and engine issues
item.description: “There’s a lot of uncertainty about Wizz’s ability to meet full-year guidance.”

item.title: Defense Lawyers Scramble to Halt Marcellus Williams’s Execution in Missouri
item.description: A hearing on Monday in the state’s Supreme Court could determine whether Marcellus Williams is executed on Tuesday for a 1998 murder conviction.

item.title: U.N. Meets Amid a Backdrop of Growing Chaos and Violence
item.description: Beginning Tuesday, world leaders will discuss three wars, climate change, rising sea levels and proposals to expand representation on the Security Cou...

item.title: Prosciutto at risk: Italy struggles to protect its 20-billion-euro pork industry from swine fever
item.description: The disease, which is fatal for pigs and disastrous for the economy, has particularly affected the northern regions of Lombardy, Piedmont and Liguria—...

item.title: Just When You Thought Politics Couldn’t Get Any Grosser
item.description: The Mark Robinson story is yet another case of self-declared morality being at variance with actual behavior.

item.title: As U.N. Meets, Pressure Mounts on Biden to Loosen Up on Arms for Ukraine
item.description: Finland’s president and NATO’s departing secretary general are urging Mr. Biden to allow Ukraine to use weapons to hit bases deeper inside Russia.

item.title: Novo Nordisk’s $570 billion valuation is more than Denmark’s GDP—but PM isn’t worried about a ‘Nokia risk’
item.description: The success of Novo’s weight-loss treatments has transformed the drugmaker into Europe’s most valuable company and made it a key driver of domestic ec...

item.title: What’s Behind Trump’s Best Poll Results in Weeks
item.description: In a shift from a Times/Siena survey last month, he leads in three Sun Belt battleground states.

item.title: The World Is a Mess. That Makes the Climate Crisis Harder to Solve.
item.description: A transformed China, conflicts in Ukraine and elsewhere, and intractable clashes over money have pushed the prospects of progress to a new low.

item.title: Zelenskyy thanks workers in visit to Pennsylvania ammunition plant—and asks for more supplies
item.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has been pushing the U.S. for permission to use longer range missile systems to fire deeper inside of Russia.

item.title: A Majority in Arizona Supports Establishing Right to Abortion, Poll Finds
item.description: A ballot measure codifying “the fundamental right to an abortion” is supported by 58 percent of the state’s likely voters, according to a New York Tim...

item.title: U.S. Research Aided Chinese Military Technology, House Republicans Say
item.description: A congressional report argues that Beijing has exploited ties with American universities to advance technologically, and that further guardrails are n...

item.title: Pinterest CEO: To protect our kids online, Congress must make digital IDs the national standard—and require OS makers to share age-validation data with apps
item.description: Multiple states and other countries already issue digital IDs while being mindful of privacy, security, and access concerns.
